topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5542a4e863687234caca1000#post_5542a4e863687234caca1000
[bq="Shadow the Hedgehog"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5542a12e6368727814430300#post_5542a12e6368727814430300
Hey, that's awesome actually.[/bq]
I just thought of something actually pretty awesome; bear with me for a second.

We can all agree that hollywood has completely ran out of reboot, sequel and remake films right?
We can all agree that hollywood for the most have no new ideas.
Anime is mainstream in the usa even though mainstream media won't touch it with a ten foot pole.
There's been several recent announcements of hollywood making live action films based upon anime.
This means that hollywood realizes they've ran out of reboot, sequel and remake films and are trying to expand by remaking anime.
The reason why this is good is that there's a language barrier so western mass media can fuck up all their want and make as shitty films as they want and it won't translate into their source material.

What I mean by this is that in say ten years instead of all those crappy quick buck movies that are remake of good movies that have been done to death or such chances are pretty good they'll turn anime shows and movies into live action western films.

*suddenly imagines Nicolas Cage playing Father Alexander Anderson*

The reason why I think it will be a good thing is look at godzilla '98; as shitty as that movie was it didn't destroy the godzilla franchise.

-If- When say the live action ghost in the shell movie comes out regardless of how shitty it's going to be it won't destroy the source material.
